sections.heading: Buildings Designated as Murray D
sections.text:
The state transportation department building in the capitol complex, Lansing, Michigan, shall be designated and known as the Murray D. Van Wagoner transportation building, and the state treasury building shall be designated and known as the Richard H. Austin building.

History:1968, Act 173, Eff. Nov. 15, 1968 ;-- Am. 1982, Act 229, Eff. Mar. 30, 1983 ;-- Am. 1999, Act 11, Imd. Eff. Apr. 27, 1999 ;-- Am. 2005, Act 209, Eff. Mar. 30, 2006

sections.heading: Buildings Renamed G. Mennen Williams Building and George W. Romney Building.
sections.text:
The following state owned buildings are renamed as follows:

(a) The law building, located in the capitol complex, is renamed the G. Mennen Williams building.

(b) The Olds Plaza building, located across Capitol Avenue from the capitol building, is renamed the George W. Romney building.

History:Add. 1996, Act 592, Imd. Eff. Jan. 22, 1997

sections.heading: Patient Programming Center in Walter P
sections.text:
The patient programming center located in the Walter P. Reuther Psychiatric Hospital in Westland, Michigan, shall be designated and known as the "James K. Haveman Center for Activity, Rehabilitation, and Therapy".

History:Add. 2016, Act 37, Imd. Eff. Mar. 8, 2016
